item.title: BNP Paribas Closes South African Corporate and Investment Bank
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BNP Paribas SA has closed its corporate and investment bank in South Africa, the latest example of a European bank scaling back on the continent. “We can confirm that we have closed BNP Paribas CIB in South Africa,” a spokesperson for the bank said by phone. “From a legal perspective,...

item.title: ECB’s Nagel Says Structural Forces Could Keep Inflation Higher
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank Governing Council member Joachim Nagel said forces including geopolitics and decarbonization could keep consumer-price growth elevated in the years ahead. “A range of potential factors could lead to higher inflationary pressure in the future,” the Bundesbank pres...

item.title: Bundesbank Chief Opposes Joint EU Borrowing Beyond NextGenEU
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Germany’s central bank chief voiced doubts over the need for joint European Union debt issuance. “I do not see much merit in giving incentives on the fiscal side to increase subsidies and state aid,” Joachim Nagel said in Frankfurt on Tuesday. “And you won’t be surprised that the Bund...

item.title: Bundesbank Chief Says EU-China Ties Need Level Playing Field
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said European Union-China relations should be “fair” and require a “level playing field.” Speaking in Frankfurt, he referred to European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, who on Monday met China’s Xi Jinping and said Europe is ready to use a...

item.title: ECB Can Cut Rates in June If Inflation Path Holds, De Cos Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank can begin to lower interest rates at its meeting next month, should there be no more jolts to consumer prices, according to Governing Council member Pablo Hernandez de Cos. “If these inflation prospects are maintained, from my point of view it would be advisa...

item.title: Amundi, Pictet Lead Contrarian Wave to US Stock Exceptionalism
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- To some investors, the US exceptionalism that’s fueled the record-breaking rally on Wall Street has run its course. Despite resilient consumption and artificial intelligence optimism, US economic growth slid to an almost two-year low last quarter while inflation stayed high. Confiden...

item.title: UniCredit’s Orcel Says All Russia-Exposed Banks Got ECB Letter
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- UniCredit SpA is likely among lenders that have received a letter by the European Central Bank urging them to reduce their exposure to Russia, after Raiffeisen Bank International AG last month revealed it was told by the regulator to further cut its Russian business. “Every single ban...

item.title: UBS Becomes First Major European Bank to Flag Hit From Rate Cut
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- UBS Group AG said the recent interest rate cut in Switzerland will hit lending income, making it the first big lender in Europe to warn that an almost two-year boost has finally turned into a headwind. The Swiss National Bank’s decision in March to cut rates will likely cause net inte...

item.title: UBS Is Adding $20 Billion in Capital Even Before Swiss Reforms
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- UBS Group AG is already adding almost $20 billion in capital to its regulatory reserves as it integrates Credit Suisse’s business, Chief Executive Officer Sergio Ermotti said, regardless of the Swiss government’s plans to increase requirements from next year. “Fully aligning the treat...

item.title: Danske Joins Citi, BNP Paribas Investing in Fintech M&A Company
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Danske Bank A/S is joining BNP Paribas SA and Citigroup Inc. by investing in a company that acquires and expands fintechs in the capital market industry. Denmark’s largest lender will take a stake in United Fintech Group for an undisclosed sum, the Copenhagen-based Danske said on Tue...

item.title: Global Funds’ China Underweight May Have Bottomed, UBS Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Global funds’ underweight position in Chinese equities may have reached a bottom as foreign inflows return, according to UBS Group AG. While emerging market funds reduced their overall China holdings by 2.9% in the first quarter, “this may be bottoming as the market has since seen a r...

item.title: UBS Returns to Profit as CEO Ermotti Affirms Buyback Plans
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- UBS Group AG returned to profit after two loss-making quarters, cementing sustained progress in the integration of Credit Suisse after its emergency rescue last year. The Zurich-based bank said net income in the first quarter was $1.8 billion, three times what analysts forecast. Whil...
